Let a triangle have vertices at $O(0,0)$, $A(a,0)$, and $B(b, c)$ in the $(x,
y)$-plane.

\begin{enumerate}[(a)]

\item Find the coordinates of a point $P(x, y)$ in the exterior of $\triangle
   OAB$ satisfying $\text{area}(\triangle OAP) = \text{area}(\triangle OBP) =
   \text{area}(\triangle ABP)$.

\item Find the coordinates of a point $Q(x, y)$ in the interior of $\triangle OAB$
   satisfying $\text{area}(\triangle OAQ) = \text{area}(\triangle OBQ) =
   \text{area}(\triangle ABQ)$.

\end{enumerate}
